summary: In this context, Buta-1,3-diene is mentioned as a volatile organic compound (VOC) that contributes to indoor air pollution and is classified as a carcinogen by the International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC). It falls under the broader category of organic chemicals, which includes various harmful substances that can accumulate in indoor environments, posing health risks such as lung cancer, particularly in vulnerable populations like children. The relationship highlights the significance of monitoring organic chemicals, including Buta-1,3-diene, in assessing cancer risks associated with air pollution.
